Reason: The configuration option 'dynamic_snitch_update_interval_in_ms' in the Cassandra software project is performance-sensitive because changing its value can significantly impact the system's performance. This configuration determines how often the dynamic snitch updates its information about node performance, affecting query routing and load balancing. A lower update interval may lead to more frequent and potentially unnecessary recalculations, impacting overall system performance. Conversely, a higher update interval may result in outdated performance information, leading to suboptimal query routing decisions. Therefore, any changes to this configuration can have notable variations in execution time and overall system performance.
